Utterance: Hi, welcome back! How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been good. I reached out to a couple of friends, and it felt great!
That’s wonderful! How did those conversations go?
They were really fulfilling. I felt more connected, and it reminded me of the importance of friendship.
That’s a great realization. Did you notice any changes in how you felt before and after reaching out?
Definitely! I felt less lonely, and it made me appreciate my friendships more.
That’s a positive outcome! Have you continued to practice setting boundaries in your interactions?
Yes, I have! I feel more confident in expressing my needs, and it’s been liberating.
That’s fantastic to hear! Have there been any challenges in maintaining those boundaries?
There was a moment when a friend pushed for details about my personal life, but I reminded myself to stay firm.
How did you handle that situation?
I told them I wasn’t comfortable sharing certain things, and they respected that. It felt good to assert myself.
That’s an excellent example of assertiveness! It’s great to see you applying what we’ve discussed. Have you noticed any changes in your emotional well-being since implementing these practices?
I feel more balanced. I’m not as easily overwhelmed by social situations.
That’s a significant improvement. Have you explored any new activities or connections since we last met?
I joined a local hiking group! It’s a great way to meet people while enjoying nature.
That sounds like a perfect fit for you! How has that experience been so far?
It’s been wonderful! Everyone is friendly, and I feel like I belong.
That’s fantastic! How do you feel when you’re in that group setting?
I feel energized and happy. It’s refreshing to be around like-minded people.
That’s a great way to foster connections. Have you thought about how you can continue to build on that sense of community?
I want to keep attending the hikes and maybe organize a group outing.
That’s a great initiative! Taking the lead can help strengthen your connections. Is there anything else you’d like to focus on today?
I think I want to explore my feelings of loneliness further. I’ve noticed it still creeps in sometimes.
That’s a valuable topic to explore. When do you find those feelings of loneliness arise most often?
Usually when I’m at home alone after a busy day. It’s like a stark contrast.
It’s understandable. Have you thought about creating a routine to address those moments?
I could plan some activities for those evenings, like reading or cooking something new.
That sounds like a great idea! Engaging in activities you enjoy can help fill those moments. Would you like to set a goal around that?
Yes, I’d like to plan at least two activities for the evenings over the next week.
That’s a solid plan! Let’s check in on how that goes next time. Remember, it’s all about progress. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think we’ve covered a lot. Thank you for your support!
You’re welcome! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. See you next time!
Bye, Ellie!
